string-array.name: answers
string-array.item: You need a launcher with Icon Pack support. Check the Google Play Store description for supported launchers. If you are not sure which launcher should you use, just go to \"Apply\" section, then choose one from the list.

Go back to main section of the app, then tap the Floating Action Button. Choose the launcher you want to apply the icons too. If your launcher is not listed there, but this icon pack is compatible with it (see on Google Play Store description for the list of supported launchers), you can apply it manually from launcher settings.
Go back to main section of the app, then tap the card which title is \"Icons\".
It depends on the launcher you are using. Not every launcher support icon editing. But, in most of them, you can edit the icon by long-pressing it or doing a double tap.
Go back to main section of the app, then tap the card which title is \"Requests\".
It happened because the icon pack was moved to SD Card, you should install it in internal storage.
The problem might come with the launcher you are using, when handling big resolution. You can fix it by increasing icon size to 115 - 120%. Or try using another launcher.
Send an icon request.
Go back to main section of the app, then tap the card which title is \"Settings\". Then check the \"Hide icon from launcher\" option.
Go to your homescreen, then create a shortcut widget for the app.
Go back to main section of the app, then tap the card which title is \"Settings\". Then uncheck the \"Hide icon from launcher\" option.
